alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Newberry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 7:12PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Fairfield, southeastern Newberry, north central Lexington, northwestern Richland and western Kershaw Counties through 800 PM EST... At 711 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dreher Island State Park to near Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam to Lexington. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Irmo, St. Andrews, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Dentsville, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Killian, Harbison State Forest, Lake Carolina, Ballentine, Blythewood, Chapin, Bundrick Island, Putnam`s Landing, White Rock, Rocky Point Recreation Area and Cedar Creek Fire Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 near mile marker 0. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 58 and 73. Interstate 26 between mile markers 92 and 108. Interstate 77 between mile markers 18 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
